variants.Description in input context: A previously reported pathogenic variant identified in a patient with early-onset Parkinson’s disease.
This variant was predicted to disrupt protein folding based on in-silico analysis.

Material used.Material Name: Fibroblast cell lines from Parkinson's patients
Material used.Description: Fibroblast cells were obtained from patient samples carrying known PINK1 mutations.

Readout description.Result Description: Western blot analysis revealed a near absence of PINK1 protein in fibroblast cell lines carrying the NM_004772.4:c.1245C>T variant.
Western blot analysis demonstrated a significant reduction (approximately 60%) of PINK1 protein levels in fibroblast cell lines carrying the NM_004772.4:c.1574G>A variant.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent fibroblast cell lines were used as biological replicates for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate for each blot.

Basic positive control.Description: Fibroblast cell lines from healthy donors were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected with an empty vector were included as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA followed by post-hoc Tukey's test for multiple comparisons was performed to analyze protein expression levels.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression between 50% and 150% of control samples.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression outside the range of 50% to 150% of control samples.

Material used.Material Source: Brain tissue sections from Parkinson's patients
Material used.Description: Brain tissue sections were obtained from a cohort of Parkinson's disease patients and age-matched controls.

Readout description.Result Description: Immunofluorescence staining revealed a severe reduction in PINK1 protein expression in neurons from Parkinson’s disease patients carrying the NM_004772.4:c.1245C>T variant compared to control samples.
Immunofluorescence staining showed a decrease in PINK1 protein expression, though not as severe as with the complete loss-of-function variant.

Biological replicates.Description: Analysis of tissue sections from at least three different patients with each variant was performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Images were captured once per tissue section.

Basic positive control.Description: Brain tissue from age-matched control subjects were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: No primary antibody control was used, relying on the specificity of established antibodies.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Qualitative assessment based on visual comparison of staining intensity.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Strong and diffuse staining for PINK1 across neuronal cell bodies.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced or absent staining for PINK1.
